title: 2 Simple Ways to Move or Delete a Slide in PowerPoint

steps.title: Open a presentation in PowerPoint.
steps.content: Open a presentation in PowerPoint. This could be a new or existing project. PowerPoint is available to download on Windows and Mac. You can also use PowerPoint at https://www.office.com/ .

steps.title: Select the slide(s) you want to delete.
steps.content: Select the slide(s) you want to delete. If you need to delete only a single slide, click it. To select multiple slides next to each other, click the first slide. Hold Shift , and then click the last side of the sequence. [1] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source To select multiple slides spread out, hold Ctrl and click each slide.

steps.title: Right-click the slide(s) and click Delete Slide.
steps.content: Right-click the slide(s) and click Delete Slide . This is in the pop-up menu, underneath Duplicate Slide . On Mac, use a control-click . The selected slide(s) will be deleted. You can also press Del or Backspace on your keyboard to delete slides. To undo this action, press Ctrl + Z (Windows) or Cmd + Z (Mac).

steps.title: Open the PowerPoint app.
steps.content: Open the PowerPoint app. This looks like an orange pie chart with a P in the front. You must have a Office 365 subscription to use PowerPoint. Make sure you're logged into your Microsoft account. If you don't already have a project open, tap one now.

steps.title: Long-press on a slide.
steps.content: Long-press on a slide. You'll see the thumbnail pane at the bottom of the screen. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Delete.
steps.content: Tap Delete . This will delete the slide. If you don't see Delete , tap the right arrow to scroll through more options.
